medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric abdominal pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first developed abdominal pain about 1 month prior to admission. Initially, she had intermittent abdominal pain, with a few good days followed by severe pain. This week, after eating certain foods, her pain worsened and radiated to her back. Pain severity has fluctuated, currently rated as severe with worsening related to movement and improved by lying still.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, recently diagnosed gallstones, prior elbow surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Has 3 children; mother has atrial fibrillation and hypertension, father deceased from cerebrovascular accident (CVA), 3 brothers reportedly healthy.
